verses.kjv: But king Solomon loved many strange women, together with the daughter of Pharaoh, women of the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Zidonians, and Hittites;
verses.ct: King Solomon was drawn to many foreign women — in addition to Pharaoh's daughter, he loved women from the Moabites, Ammonites, Edomites, Sidonians, and Hittites.

verses.kjv: Of the nations concerning which the LORD said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither shall they come in unto you: for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods: Solomon clave unto these in love.
verses.ct: These were from the very nations about which the LORD had told the Israelites, 'You must not intermarry with them, and they must not intermarry with you, because they will certainly lead your hearts toward their gods.' Yet Solomon held on to them in love.

verses.kjv: And he had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines: and his wives turned away his heart.
verses.ct: He had 700 wives of royal birth and 300 secondary wives, and his wives pulled his heart away.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, when Solomon was old, that his wives turned away his heart after other gods: and his heart was not perfect with the LORD his God, as was the heart of David his father.
verses.ct: As Solomon grew old, his wives drew his heart toward other gods, and he was no longer fully devoted to the LORD his God the way his father David had been.

verses.kjv: For Solomon went after Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, and after Milcom the abomination of the Ammonites.
verses.ct: Solomon followed Ashtoreth, the goddess of the Sidonians, and Milcom, the disgusting idol of the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And Solomon did evil in the sight of the LORD, and went not fully after the LORD, as did David his father.
verses.ct: Solomon did what was evil in the LORD's sight and did not follow the LORD completely as his father David had done.

verses.kjv: Then did Solomon build an high place for Chemosh, the abomination of Moab, in the hill that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech, the abomination of the children of Ammon.
verses.ct: Solomon even constructed a worship site on the hill east of Jerusalem for Chemosh, the disgusting idol of Moab, and for Molech, the disgusting idol of the Ammonites.

verses.kjv: And likewise did he for all his strange wives, which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods.
verses.ct: He did the same for all of his foreign wives, who burned incense and offered sacrifices to their gods.

verses.kjv: And the LORD was angry with Solomon, because his heart was turned from the LORD God of Israel, which had appeared unto him twice,
verses.ct: The LORD became angry with Solomon because his heart had drifted away from the LORD, the God of Israel, who had appeared to him twice.

verses.kjv: And had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he kept not that which the LORD commanded.
verses.ct: God had specifically warned him not to follow other gods, but Solomon refused to obey what the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the LORD said unto Solomon, Forasmuch as this is done of thee, and thou hast not kept my covenant and my statutes, which I have commanded thee, I will surely rend the kingdom from thee, and will give it to thy servant.
verses.ct: So the LORD said to Solomon, 'Since you have done this and have not kept my covenant and the laws I gave you, I will certainly tear the kingdom away from you and hand it to one of your servants.

verses.kjv: Notwithstanding in thy days I will not do it for David thy father’s sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thy son.
verses.ct: However, I will not do it during your lifetime, for the sake of your father David. Instead, I will tear it from the hand of your son.

verses.kjv: Howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one tribe to thy son for David my servant’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake which I have chosen.
verses.ct: Even then, I will not tear away the entire kingdom. I will leave your son one tribe, for the sake of my servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, which I have chosen.'

verses.kjv: And the LORD stirred up an adversary unto Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king’s seed in Edom.
verses.ct: Then the LORD raised up an enemy against Solomon — Hadad the Edomite, who was from the royal family of Edom.

verses.kjv: For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom;
verses.ct: Earlier, when David had been at war in Edom, Joab the army commander had gone to bury the dead and had killed every male in Edom.

verses.kjv: (For six months did Joab remain there with all Israel, until he had cut off every male in Edom:)
verses.ct: (Joab and all the Israelite forces stayed there for 6 months until they had wiped out every male in Edom.)

verses.kjv: That Hadad fled, he and certain Edomites of his father’s servants with him, to go into Egypt; Hadad being yet a little child.
verses.ct: But Hadad, who was still a young boy at the time, escaped along with some of his father's Edomite servants, heading for Egypt.

verses.kjv: And they arose out of Midian, and came to Paran: and they took men with them out of Paran, and they came to Egypt, unto Pharaoh king of Egypt; which gave him an house, and appointed him victuals, and gave him land.
verses.ct: They left Midian and traveled to Paran, where they gathered more men. Then they continued on to Egypt, to Pharaoh king of Egypt, who provided Hadad with a house, gave him food, and granted him land.

verses.kjv: And Hadad found great favour in the sight of Pharaoh, so that he gave him to wife the sister of his own wife, the sister of Tahpenes the queen.
verses.ct: Hadad greatly impressed Pharaoh, so much so that Pharaoh gave him his own wife's sister — the sister of Queen Tahpenes — as his wife.

verses.kjv: And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh’s house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh’s household among the sons of Pharaoh.
verses.ct: Tahpenes' sister gave birth to his son Genubath, and Tahpenes raised the boy in Pharaoh's palace. Genubath grew up in Pharaoh's household alongside Pharaoh's own sons.

verses.kjv: And when Hadad heard in Egypt that David slept with his fathers, and that Joab the captain of the host was dead, Hadad said to Pharaoh, Let me depart, that I may go to mine own country.
verses.ct: While in Egypt, Hadad received word that David had died and that Joab the army commander was also dead. So Hadad said to Pharaoh, 'Let me leave so I can return to my own country.'

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh said unto him, But what hast thou lacked with me, that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? And he answered, Nothing: howbeit let me go in any wise.
verses.ct: Pharaoh asked him, 'What have you been lacking here with me that you suddenly want to go back to your own country?' Hadad replied, 'Nothing at all — but please, just let me go.'

verses.kjv: And God stirred him up another adversary, Rezon the son of Eliadah, which fled from his lord Hadadezer king of Zobah:
verses.ct: God also raised up another enemy against Solomon — Rezon son of Eliadah, who had fled from his master Hadadezer king of Zobah.

verses.kjv: And he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them of Zobah: and they went to Damascus, and dwelt therein, and reigned in Damascus.
verses.ct: Rezon gathered a group of men around himself and became the leader of a raiding band after David had defeated the forces of Zobah. They went to Damascus, settled there, and Rezon ruled in Damascus.

verses.kjv: And he was an adversary to Israel all the days of Solomon, beside the mischief that Hadad did: and he abhorred Israel, and reigned over Syria.
verses.ct: Rezon was an enemy of Israel throughout Solomon's entire reign, adding to the trouble that Hadad caused. He despised Israel and ruled over Aram.

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam the son of Nebat, an Ephrathite of Zereda, Solomon’s servant, whose mother’s name was Zeruah, a widow woman, even he lifted up his hand against the king.
verses.ct: There was also Jeroboam son of Nebat, an Ephraimite from Zereda, one of Solomon's officials. His mother was a widow named Zeruah. He too rebelled against the king.

verses.kjv: And this was the cause that he lifted up his hand against the king: Solomon built Millo, and repaired the breaches of the city of David his father.
verses.ct: Here is the background of his rebellion: Solomon was building the Millo and closing up the gaps in the wall of his father David's city.

verses.kjv: And the man Jeroboam was a mighty man of valour: and Solomon seeing the young man that he was industrious, he made him ruler over all the charge of the house of Joseph.
verses.ct: Jeroboam was a capable and energetic man, and when Solomon noticed how hard the young man worked, he put him in charge of all the labor force from the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass at that time when Jeroboam went out of Jerusalem, that the prophet Ahijah the Shilonite found him in the way; and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alone in the field:
verses.ct: Around that time, Jeroboam was leaving Jerusalem when the prophet Ahijah from Shiloh met him on the road. Ahijah was wearing a new robe, and the two of them were alone out in the open countryside.

verses.kjv: And Ahijah caught the new garment that was on him, and rent it in twelve pieces:
verses.ct: Ahijah grabbed the new robe he was wearing and ripped it into 12 pieces.

verses.kjv: And he said to Jeroboam, Take thee ten pieces: for thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, Behold, I will rend the kingdom out of the hand of Solomon, and will give ten tribes to thee:
verses.ct: Then he told Jeroboam, 'Take 10 of these pieces for yourself, because this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: "Pay attention — I am about to tear the kingdom from Solomon's grip and give 10 tribes to you.

verses.kjv: (But he shall have one tribe for my servant David’s sake, and for Jerusalem’s sake, the city which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel:)
verses.ct: (But Solomon will keep one tribe, for the sake of my servant David and for the sake of Jerusalem, the city I have chosen from among all the tribes of Israel.)

verses.kjv: Because that they have forsaken me, and have worshipped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Zidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the children of Ammon, and have not walked in my ways, to do that which is right in mine eyes, and to keep my statutes and my judgments, as did David his father.
verses.ct: I am doing this because they have abandoned me and worshiped Ashtoreth the goddess of the Sidonians, Chemosh the god of the Moabites, and Milcom the god of the Ammonites. They have not followed my ways or done what is right in my sight, and they have not kept my laws and regulations as David his father did.

verses.kjv: Howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of his hand: but I will make him prince all the days of his life for David my servant’s sake, whom I chose, because he kept my commandments and my statutes:
verses.ct: Still, I will not take the whole kingdom from Solomon himself. I will let him remain ruler for the rest of his life, for the sake of my servant David, whom I chose because he obeyed my commands and my laws.

verses.kjv: But I will take the kingdom out of his son’s hand, and will give it unto thee, even ten tribes.
verses.ct: But I will take the kingdom from his son's control and give 10 tribes to you.

verses.kjv: And unto his son will I give one tribe, that David my servant may have a light alway before me in Jerusalem, the city which I have chosen me to put my name there.
verses.ct: I will leave his son one tribe so that my servant David will always have a lasting legacy in my presence in Jerusalem, the city I chose as the place for my name.

verses.kjv: And I will take thee, and thou shalt reign according to all that thy soul desireth, and shalt be king over Israel.
verses.ct: As for you, I will take you, and you will rule over everything your heart desires. You will be king over Israel.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that is right in my sight, to keep my statutes and my commandments, as David my servant did; that I will be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for David, and will give Israel unto thee.
verses.ct: If you listen to everything I command you, follow my ways, and do what is right in my sight by keeping my laws and commands — just as my servant David did — then I will be with you. I will establish a lasting dynasty for you, just as I did for David, and I will give Israel to you.

verses.kjv: And I will for this afflict the seed of David, but not for ever.
verses.ct: Because of all this, I will humble David's descendants, though not forever."'

verses.kjv: Solomon sought therefore to kill Jeroboam. And Jeroboam arose, and fled into Egypt, unto Shishak king of Egypt, and was in Egypt until the death of Solomon.
verses.ct: Solomon then tried to kill Jeroboam, but Jeroboam escaped and fled to Egypt, to King Shishak. He remained in Egypt until Solomon died.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Solomon, and all that he did, and his wisdom, are they not written in the book of the acts of Solomon?
verses.ct: The rest of Solomon's accomplishments — everything he did and all his wisdom — are recorded in the book of the history of Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was forty years.
verses.ct: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all of Israel for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Then Solomon died and joined his ancestors. He was buried in the city of his father David, and his son Rehoboam became king after him.
